info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 9:27AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...THUNDERSTORMS WITH VERY HEAVY RAINFALL WILL IMPACT ELBERT... SOUTHERN ABBEVILLE AND GREENWOOD COUNTIES UNTIL 1015 AM EDT... At 926 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms with very heavy rainfall along a line extending from 4 miles northeast of Greenwood to 13 miles southeast of Abbeville to 4 miles west of Elberton, and moving east at 15 mph. Locations to be impacted include... Greenwood, Abbeville, Elberton, Calhoun Falls, Ninety Six, Troy, Lake Greenwood State Park, Greenwood State Park, Russell State Park and Middleton. Very heavy rainfall rates up to 2 inches per hour will be possible in these areas.
info.instruction: Very heavy rainfall may flood areas with poor drainage, such as ditches and underpasses. Avoid these areas and do not cross flooded roads. Water levels of small streams may also rise rapidly. Seek higher ground if threatened by flood waters.
